contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=October 2008}} '''''Mr. Halpern and Mr. Johnson''''' is a 1983 TV movie produced for [[HBO]] featuring [[Jackie Gleason]] and [[Laurence Olivier]] and was directed by [[Alvin Rakoff]]. The film is set at Halpern's (Olivier) wife's gravesite after the funeral. Halpern, a [[working class]] [[British people|British]] [[Jew]], is incensed when Johnson, a dapper [[United States|American]] (Gleason), turns up with flowers for the deceased, rather than stones as in [[Jewish custom]]. When Halpern demands to know how Johnson knew his wife, a long conversation ensues that reveals one has been in love with the other's wife for 30 years. There are two locations in the movie, a New York hotel and a New Jersey cemetery. The hotel scene was filmed at the HTV West studio on Bath Road in Bristol, England and the cemetery scenes were filmed outside Bristol. The screenplay was written by Lionel Goldstein. Rabbi Kenneth L. Cohen was the religious advisor. ==External links== *[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0085969/ at IMDb] [[Category:1983 films]] [[Category:1980s drama films]] [[Category:English-language films]] {{TV-movie-stub}}
